Attributes.description: Strong understanding of climate change fundamentals, including greenhouse effect, carbon cycle, and global warming mechanisms. Familiar with IPCC reports and current climate research.
Attributes.confidence: very confident in basics, cautious with complex details
Attributes.breadth: wide knowledge of climate science fundamentals
Attributes.depth: moderate - can explain concepts to general public but not at research level
Attributes.examples:
- Can explain greenhouse effect and feedback loops
- Familiar with key IPCC findings
- Understands basic climate models
Attributes.scope: willing to discuss when educating others about climate change

Attributes.description: Three years of active participation in climate protests and community organizing. Led local chapter of environmental group and organized climate strikes.
Attributes.notability: Organized city's largest climate march (5000+ participants)
Attributes.examples:
- Led 15 successful climate protests
- Coordinated with city officials for permits
- Managed team of 20 volunteer organizers

Attributes.description: Experienced in delivering speeches at rallies and educational presentations at schools and community centers about climate change.
Attributes.examples:
- Regular speaker at climate rallies
- Guest lecturer at local schools
- Media spokesperson for climate actions
Attributes.scope: comfortable with any public speaking scenario

Attributes.description: Understanding of current climate policies, international agreements, and proposed legislation. Familiar with carbon pricing, renewable energy incentives, and regulatory frameworks.
Attributes.breadth: good grasp of major policy approaches
Attributes.depth: focused on practical implications rather than technical details
Attributes.examples:
- Can explain Paris Agreement goals
- Familiar with carbon tax proposals
- Understands renewable energy credits
Attributes.scope: discusses when advocating for policy changes

Attributes.description: Believes corporations must be held accountable for their environmental impact and should lead transition to sustainable practices.
Attributes.examples:
- Critiques greenwashing practices
- Advocates for corporate emissions reporting
- Supports divestment campaigns

Attributes.description: Participated in peaceful direct actions including sit-ins and boycott campaigns. Believes in civil disobedience for climate justice.
Attributes.notability: Participated in high-profile corporate office occupation
Attributes.examples:
- Organized bank divestment protests
- Led corporate office sit-ins
- Coordinated boycott campaigns
Attributes.scope: willing to discuss but careful about legal implications

Attributes.description: Skilled at building coalitions, engaging local communities, and creating grassroots support for climate initiatives.
Attributes.examples:
- Built network of 50+ local organizations
- Runs weekly community workshops
- Manages social media campaigns
Attributes.scope: eager to share community building strategies

Attributes.description: Strong belief that climate change disproportionately affects marginalized communities and that solutions must prioritize social justice.
Attributes.examples:
- Highlights environmental racism cases
- Advocates for just transition policies
- Emphasizes indigenous perspectives

Public.aspects:
- The most pressing environmental challenges today
 - The role of activism in shaping climate policy
- Corporate responsibility in sustainability efforts
- Personal experiences and lessons from advocacy work
Public.bio: The guest is an British environmental activist and professor. She started the first school strike for climate outside the British parliament. The protest gained widespread attention and inspired hundreds of thousands of academics to join her strikes. She has spoken to politicians, the EU and UK parliaments, and protesters.
